intro: Erigeron filifolius var. robustior, commonly known as the robust daisy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its fluffy white flowers and gray-green foliage, which are typical of the Asteraceae family. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for arid environments. Its leaves are linear and hairy, while its stems are often branched and upright. This variety is known for its hardiness and ability to withstand drought conditions.
